results.title: The F.B.I.
results.creator_credit: Fortune Films, Time-Life Films and Time Inc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Describes the 24-hour-a-day vigilance of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the techniques and crime detection methods shown at the F.B.I. laboratories, and the rigorous training an agent must undergo. Dramatizes the case of the Nazi spy, August Baumeyer, and illustrates the effectiveness of counter-espionage by the F.B.I. Features F.B.I. Director, John Edgar Hoover.

results.title: The F-111 story
results.brief_description: The development of the F-111 airplane with its controversial variable swing wing construction. A pioneer in aircraft design…shows scenes of flight testing, and demonstrations of this aircraft’s capabilities.

results.title: The Eyes have it...or do they?
results.brief_description: Explores the major aspects of vision and the way in which it determines one’s conception of the world. Suggests that physically different eyes perceive reality differently. Shows the influence of physical and chemical stiumlation on the eye and discusses sensitivity to color, light, shadow, form and line.

results.title: The Eyes have it
results.creator_credit: Interkal Productions, National Society for the Prevention of Blindness and Dave Gilbert
results.brief_description: Marionettes led by an owl accompanied by a piano playing fox and the fern forest orchestra sing a song of advice about eye care. Other marionettes act out the words of the song. Later the song is repeated, with some different activities while the words are flashed on the screen.

results.title: The Eye: an inside story

results.title: The Eye of the glasses
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Clifton and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A mugger kills a passing stranger and inherits a pair of spectacles with magical properties. The glasses reveal the physical world to him as his subconscious perceives it.

results.title: The Eye of the beholder
results.brief_description: Illustrates the idea that people often see what they want to see, what they are prepared to see and not what actually exists. A series of incidents involving an artist who appears to be involved in the murder of a woman are presented. These show how he appears to his mother, to a waiter, a cab driver, his landlord and a cleaning lady. The story, as seen through the eyes of these beholders is quite different from what we see when the entire incident is repeated as it actually happened. The films emphasises the importance of caution in judging people and that no two people see the same thing the same way.

results.title: The Extraordinary experience of Nicholas Nodwell
results.brief_description: Nicholas is usually inattentive at school and likes to daydream. During a lesson on the production and uses of petroleum he finds himself transported into a strange world without petroleum. He learns how much our modern society depends on petroleum products. Script by Frank Colyer.
